1455544320522657810.text: Congress has a moral obligation to defend every American’s right to vote by passing the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act of 2021, now. 3/3

1455544318832353288.text: Further, it ensures that changes in voting is limited to a set of measures, such as the institution of a voter ID law or the reduction of multilingual voting materials – practices that have historically been found to have the greatest discriminatory impact. 2/3

1455544317125275657.text: The John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act establishes a targeted process for reviewing voting changes in jurisdictions nationwide and is specifically focused on measures that have historically been used to discriminate against voters. 1/3

1455243632542425094.text: The #BuildBackBetter framework will set the United States on course to meet its climate targets—a 50-52% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions below 2005 levels by 2030—in a way that creates good-paying union jobs, grows domestic industries, and advances environmental justice.

1455241571914461190.text: The framework will also provide a tax cut of up to $1,500 in tax cuts for more than 1.5 million low-wage workers in Texas by extending the American Rescue Plan’s Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) expansion.

1455241376828960774.text: The #BuildBackBetterAct framework extends the Child Tax Credit (CTC) increases of $300/month per child under 6 or $250/month per child ages 6 to 17. This will continue the largest one-year reduction in child poverty in history.

1455241117818032129.text: Prior to the pandemic, 15% of children under the age of 18 in Texas lived in poverty. The #BuildBackBetter framework will bolster financial security and spur economic growth in Texas by reducing taxes on the middle class and those striving to break into it.

1455240731350736902.text: #BuildBackBetter closes the Medicaid coverage gap, helping millions of Americans gain health insurance during a global pandemic!

1455238610190536704.text: The #BuildBackBetter framework will enable Texas to expand access to free, high-quality preschool to more than 588,286 additional 3- and 4-year-olds per year and increase the quality of preschool for children who are already enrolled.

1455238184380649479.text: Texas families spend $9,428, or 21% of their income on child care for one year. The Build Back Better framework will enable Texas to provide access to childcare for 2,011,503 young children (ages 0-5) per year from families earning under 2.5 times the Texas median income.

1455237519470116866.text: The #BuildBackBetter framework will be transformative for nearly every Texas family: delivering historic investments that meet their needs in the wake of the pandemic and will ensure that all can share in the benefits of a growing economy now, and for generations to come.

1455237386779115523.text: Democrats’ Build Back Better framework – which we will soon enact into law – will deliver for Texas’ families, with millions of good-paying jobs, historic middle class tax cuts and lower costs, so parents can thrive and succeed.

1455237290704449540.text: For far too long, Texas’ families have been held back by soaring costs – from childcare to health care to education to the climate crisis and more. To unleash the full potential of every worker and family in our state, Democrats must #BuildBackBetter.

1455236982200807426.text: The #BuildBackBetter framework delivers transformative investments that will address these needs and finally unlock the full potential of Texas’ families, while also ensuring that the wealthiest and corporations pay their fair share.

1455236809047351298.text: In the wake of the pandemic, skyrocketing costs of childcare, health care, home, and community-based care, early and higher education, housing, and more are hurting working families across Texas and around the nation.  We must #BuildBackBetter.
